qas.question: What scale is used by most Somali songs?
How many notes are in a hepatonic scale?
What is an exaple of a hepatonic scale?
Along with Arabia and Ethiopia, what land has songs that sound similar to those of Somalia?
What does midho mean in English?

context: Somalis have a rich musical heritage centered on traditional Somali folklore. Most Somali songs are <a0_0>pentatonic<a0_0/>. That is, they only use five pitches per octave in contrast to a heptatonic (<a1_0>seven<a1_0/> note) scale, such as <a2_0>the major scale<a2_0/>. At first listen, Somali music might be mistaken for the sounds of nearby regions such as Ethiopia, <a3_0>Sudan<a3_0/> or Arabia, but it is ultimately recognizable by its own unique tunes and styles. Somali songs are usually the product of collaboration between <a4_0>lyricists<a4_0/> (midho), songwriters (lahan) and singers ('odka or "voice").
